title: World
fact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.

title: Nepal
fact: Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.

title: Egypt
fact: The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

title: India
fact: India is the world’s largest democracy and the second most populous country.

title: China
fact: China is the world’s most populous country and home to the Great Wall of China.

title: Brazil
fact: Brazil is the largest country in South America and home to the Amazon Rainforest.

title: Australia
fact: Australia is the only country that is also a continent.

title: Japan
fact: Japan is known as the 'Land of the Rising Sun' and has the world’s third-largest economy.

title: Canada
fact: Canada is the second-largest country in the world by area.

title: France
fact: France is the most visited country in the world.

title: South Africa
fact: South Africa has three capital cities and is known as the 'Rainbow Nation'.

title: Mexico
fact: Mexico is home to ancient civilizations like the Aztecs and Mayans.
